intro: Trichocentrum albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of trees without deriving nutrients from them. The plant features long, arching stems that bear clusters of fragrant, white flowers with yellow lips.
